name.description: The name of the OpenLDAP service instance

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each OpenLDAP node.

mem.description: Memory to allocate to each OpenLDAP node.

config_password.description: Allows password protected access to the dn=config branch. This helps to reconfigure the server without interruption. Defaults to 'password'

additional_schemas.description: Loads additional schemas provided in the slapd package.

additional_modules.description: Comma-separated list of modules to load.

force_reconfigure.description: Reconfigure the service after the image has been initialized. Defaults to FALSE

persistence.description: Enable or disable data persistence. If enabled, requires configuration of a valid host_volume.

host_volume.description: The location of a volume on the host to be used for persisting OpenLDAP data. The final location will be derived from this value plus the name set in `name` (e.g. `/mnt/host_volume/openldap`). Note that this path must be the same on all DCOS agents. Required.

ldap_volume_size.description: If a new volume is to be created for the LDAP database, this controls its size in MBs. Defaults to 64MBs

slapd_volume_size.description: If a new volume is to be created for internal storage of the SLAPD daemon, this controls its size in MBs. Defaults to 64MBs

port.description: Port number to be used for clear communication inside the cluster. DO NOT MODIFY if using in conjunction the DC/OS openldap-admin package

external_access.description: Enable or disable creating a VIP for external access through a public node running Marathon-LB. Defaults to FALSE

port_external.description: For external access, the port number to be used for clear communication in the external load balancer

virtual_host.description: For external access, virtual Host URL to be used in the external load balancer. Modify as per your installation.
